ygData.subject: Re: [archive-crawler] seeds with danish characters are not accepted
ygData.msgSnippet: In CVS HEAD, the seed parsing regex has been loosened so that if www.pølse.dk is encountered, it will at least be tried as http://www.pølse.dk . However,

Subject: Re: [archive-crawler] seeds with danish characters are not accepted
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=137285340; y=afT4YnD5SCc3ZmAnQNc4mAsT57uOlMLH3yr1N_rXGV2p

In CVS HEAD, the seed parsing regex has been loosened so that if
'www.p�lse.dk' is encountered, it will at least be tried as
'http://www.p�lse.dk'.

However, this then hits a URIException thrown by Heritrix's
UURIFactory in checkDomainLabel(), where we enforce legal
classic domain names (post IDN punycoding), even though there's
been no step to apply such encoding, if necessary, yet.

If this check is disabled, the URI will be scheduled... but
then it appears URI-escaping, rather than punycoding, is
applied to the domain-name -- even though there is some
indication that the HttpClient URI class knows about
punycoding.

In the case of a narrow crawl, I then saw it ruled out --
upon scope rechecking, apparently it didn't match the domain
allowed as part of scope initialization.

In the case of a broad crawl, the DNS lookup was hanging. The
DNSJava library we're using claims current IDN support, but
it's unclear when it was added. (We're currently bundling
version 1.6.2 from March 2004; it's up to 2.0 as of a few
weeks ago.)

So it'll require more investigation, but it's a definite bug.
I've made an issue here:

http://sourceforge.net/tracker/index.php?func=detail&aid=1222229&group_id=73833&atid=539099

- Gordon @ IA

Bjarne Andersen wrote:
> a seed like: www.p�lse.dk is rejected
> 
> If you cannot see the 6th char in the name its an o with a slash !
> 
> In denmark such names are now both legal and available allthough most 
> browsers don't support them without a plugin
> 
> How much would it take to get heritrix to crawl such domains ? (if the 
> http-client can handle them ?)
> 
> best
